titleStmt.title: List of research software mentioned in ADHO conference abstracts

item.name: JavaScript
item.note: a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web

item.name: React
item.note: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

item.name: Jupyter Notebook
item.note: a web application for creating and sharing computational documents

item.name: PoetryLab
item.note: an extensible open source toolkit for syllabification, scansion (extraction of stress patterns), enjambment detection (syntactical units split in two lines), rhyme detection, and historical named entity recognition for Spanish poetry

item.name: spaCy
item.note: Industrial Strength Natural Language Processing in Python

item.name: Rantanplan
item.note: Scansion tool for Spanish texts in Python

item.name: JollyJumper
item.note: Enjambment detection Python library for Spanish

item.name: Rolling.Classify
item.note: Function that splits a text into equal-sized consecutive blocks (slices) and performs a supervised classification of these blocks against a training set.

item.name: Rolling.Delta
item.note: Function that analyses collaborative works and tries to determine the authorship of their fragments.

item.name: ANNIS
item.note: A web browser-based search and visualization architecture for complex multilayer linguistic corpora with diverse types of annotation.

item.name: IncipitSearch
item.note: A webservice for aggregating and searching notated music incipits.

item.name: ZeuScansion
item.note: ZeuScansion is a fst-based system capable of performing metrical scansion of poetry written in English.

item.name: the Scandroid 1.1
item.note: The Scandroid is a program that scans English verse in iambic and anapestic meters.
A metrical scansion system for fixed-metre Spanish poetry.
A Comparison of Feature-Based and Neural Scansion of Poetry
A Logic Programming Application for the Analysis of Spanish Verse

item.name: FreeLing
item.note: an open source language analysis tool suite

item.name: spacy-affixes
item.note: package which splits words with affixes before assigning PoS
La transcripcion fonetica automatica del diccionario electronico de formas simples flexivas del español: un estudio fonologico en el lexico.

item.name: HisMeTag
item.note: Hispanic Medieval Tagger (HisMeTag): una aplicación web para el etiquetado de entidades en textos medievales.

item.name: VOSviewer
item.note: a computer program for bibliometric mapping

item.name: SALSAH
item.note: System for Annotation and Linkage of Sources in Arts and Humanities

item.name: Knora
DaSCH Service Platform API
item.note: DSP is a server application for storing, sharing, and working with primary sources and data in the humanities.

item.name: eXist-db
item.note: a NoSQL Document Database and Application Platform

item.name: Apache Jena
item.note: A free and open source Java framework for building Semantic Web and Linked Data applications.

item.name: A-Frame
item.note: an open-source web framework for building virtual reality (VR) experiences (JavaScript)

item.name: Gephi
item.note: visualization and exploration software for all kinds of graphs and networks

item.name: Scalar
item.note: Scalar is a free, open source authoring and publishing platform that’s designed to make it easy for authors to write long-form, born-digital scholarship online.

item.name: Wandora
item.note: knowledge management application; Wandora is a desktop application to collect, store, manipulate and publish information, especially associative data and data about WWW resources. Wandora's data model is multilayered and based on Topic Maps.

item.name: ArcGIS
item.note: Mapping and Analytics Software and Services

item.name: Dig@IT
item.note: Immersive Visualization and Curation of Archaeological Heritage Data

Lercari, N., Jaffke, D., Aboulhosn, J., Baird, G. y Guillem, A. (2018). Citizen Science Archaeology at Bodie State Historic Park. Society for American Archaeology Conference: Abstracts of the 83rd annual meeting. Washington DC, p. 283.
Lingle, A. y Seifert, J. (2017). Update on the Çatalhöyük Digital Preservation Project. Çatalhöyük 2017 Archive Report.

item.name: Semantic MediaWiki
item.note: Semantic MediaWiki (SMW) is a free, open-source ex­ten­sion to MediaWiki – the wiki soft­ware that pow­ers Wikipedia – that lets you store and query data with­in the wiki's pages.

item.name: Pytesseract
item.note: Python-tesseract is an optical character recognition (OCR) tool for python.

item.name: OpenCV
item.note: OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is a library of programming functions mainly aimed at real-time computer vision.

item.name: Omeka
item.note: Open-source web publishing platforms for sharing digital collections and creating media-rich online exhibits.

item.name: Carta
item.note: Carta Leaflet map plugin for Omeka

item.name: Webpack
item.note: At its core, webpack is a static module bundler for modern JavaScript applications.

item.name: Enciclopedia de la Literatura en México (ELEM)
Literature Translation
item.note: Map of literary translations with data from the Encyclopedia of Mexican Literature a collaboration between de Fundación Mexicana para las Letras and the Daniel Cosío Villegas Library.

item.name: Leaflet
item.note: Leaflet is the leading open-source JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps. Weighing just about 42 KB of JS, it has all the mapping features most developers ever need.

item.name: Ugarit
item.note: A web-based translation alignment editor. Ugarit is designed as a Citizen Science tool, aiming at collecting training datasets of manually aligned words from diverse text corpora. The ultimate goal of Ugarit is to improve automatic translation alignment methods and to implement a set of dynamic lexica, with particular regard for languages with less supported infrastructures.

item.name: OpenTOSCA
item.note: Open-source implementation of the TOSCA standard.

item.name: TOSCA
item.note: Topology and Orchestration Specification for Cloud Applications

item.name: Winery
item.note: Eclipse Winery is a web-based environment to graphically model TOSCA topologies and plans managing these topologies. The environment includes a type and template management component to offer creation and modification of all elements defined in the TOSCA specification. All information is stored in a repository, which allows importing and exporting using the TOSCA packaging format.

item.name: GeoNewsMiner
item.note: The GeoNewsMiner (GNM) is an interactive tool that maps and visualises geographical references in historical newspapers.

item.name: SOLR
item.note: Open source enterprise search platform built on Apache Lucene

item.name: ReRites
item.note: Used neural net trained on various corpora to produce poetry.

item.name: SonGenApp
item.note: Web application that enables a user to select verses from a large corpus of sonnets to assemble a new poem.

item.name: word2vec
item.note: Word2vec is a technique for natural language processing (NLP) published in 2013. The word2vec algorithm uses a neural network model to learn word associations from a large corpus of text.

item.name: Golden Agents
item.note: The Golden Agents project is developing a sustainable research infrastructure to study relations and interactions between producers and consumers of creative goods. This infrastructure enables interaction between various heterogeneous databases by using a combination of semantic web solutions and multi-agent technology that will be supported by ontologies developed together with domain experts.

item.name: D3.js
item.note: D3.js is a JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data.
D3 was created by Mike Bostock in 2011. Mike co-authored the D3 paper with Jeff Heer and Vadim Ogievetsky at Stanford.

item.name: The Entity Mapper
item.note: A Data Visualization Tool for Qualitative Research Methods

item.name: Revistas Culturales 2.0
item.note: Virtual research environment for the investigation of Spanish-language cultural magazines

item.name: MapModern
item.note: Mapping Hispanic Modernity. Cross-border Literary Networks and Cultural Mediators (1908-1939)

item.name: nodegoat
item.note: nodegoat is a web-based research environment for the humanities

item.name: Final_Cut
item.note: a series of non-linear video editing software programs

item.name: Premiere
item.note: a timeline-based and non-linear video editing software application (NLE) developed by Adobe Inc.

item.name: Lignes de temps
item.note: Le logiciel Lignes de temps met à profit les possibilités d’analyse et de synthèse offertes par le support numérique. Inspirées par les «timelines» ordinairement utilisées sur les bancs de montage numérique, Lignes de temps propose une représentation graphique d’un film, révélant d’emblée, et in extenso, son découpage.

item.name: Advene
item.note: Advene (Annotate Digital Video, Exchange on the NEt) is an ongoing project aiming at providing a model and a format to share annotations about digital video documents (movies, courses, conferences...), as well as tools to edit and visualize the hypervideos generated from both the annotations and the audiovisual documents. Teachers, moviegoers, researchers, etc. can use them to exchange multimedia comments and analyses about video documents.

item.name: Vialogues
item.note: Vialogues allow you to share externally created and hosted video content (YouTube, Vimeo) or upload a video to Vialogues and create an interactive, asychronous discussion on that video with your students.

item.name: VideoAnt
item.note: VideoAnt is a web-based video annotation tool for mobile and desktop devices.

item.name: Pad.ma
item.note: Pad.ma is an online archive of densely text-annotated video material, primarily footage and not finished films.

item.name: MemoRekall
item.note: Une application libre et gratuite d'annotation et commentaire vidéo pour la médiation numérique

item.name: Logo
item.note: a programming language and graphical environment for computer science education

item.name: Snap!
item.note: Snap! is a broadly inviting programming language for kids and adults that's also a platform for serious study of computer science.

item.name: Voyant Tools
item.note: Voyant Tools is a web-based reading and analysis environment for digital texts.

item.name: Catalogue of Digital Editions: The Web Application
OpenTermAlign
item.note: OpenTermAlign (HTK-OTA) used in the OpenArcheo platform by MASA is a customized fork specific for archeological DB mappings using PACTOLS, export in SKOS format, 6 languages supported.

item.name: BBTalk
item.note: a thesaurus submission and connection management tool

item.name: Vocabulary Matching Tool
item.note: It is intended to aid in the creation of mappings from locally used terms/concepts to the Getty Art & Architecture Thesaurus (AAT)

item.name: VisTA
item.note: Visual Terminology Alignment Tool for Factual Knowledge Aggregation

item.name: 3M: Mapping Memory Manager
item.note: Mapping Memory Manager (3M) is a package for managing mapping definition files.

item.name: Heterotoki
item.note: Online application to map heterogeneous terminologies.

item.name: PHP
item.note: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language geared toward web development.

item.name: Atlas de la Narrativa Mexicana del siglo XX
Atlas de la Narrativa Mexicana del siglo XX
item.note: Herramienta Web Para La Identificación De La Técnica De Manufactura En Fotografías Históricas

item.name: RAÍCES
item.note: un juego serio social para revalorizar las culturas originarias

item.name: Borderlands Archives Cartography
item.note: localiza, digitaliza, facilita y compila archivos periodísticos de ambos lados de la frontera Estados Unidos-México

item.name: CARTO
item.note: Cloud-native location intelligence & GIS software for analysts, data scientists & developers solving geospatial problems with modern analytics stacks.

item.name: Spatial Humanities Kit
item.note: The Spatial Humanities Kit is a durable media production toolset designed to fit in a backpack.

item.name: Google Drive
item.note: Google Drive is a file storage and synchronization service developed by Google.

item.name: RAWGraphs
item.note: A free and open source tool for data visualization

item.name: MOSES
item.note: Open source toolkit for statistical machine translation.

item.name: GIZA++
item.note: GIZA++ is an extension of the program GIZA (part of the SMT toolkit EGYPT) which was developed by the Statistical Machine Translation team during the summer workshop in 1999 at the Center for Language and Speech Processing at Johns-Hopkins University (CLSP/JHU).

item.name: OpenNMT
item.note: OpenNMT is an open source ecosystem for neural machine translation and neural sequence learning.
Started in December 2016 by the Harvard NLP group and SYSTRAN, the project has since been used in several research and industry applications. It is currently maintained by SYSTRAN and Ubiqus.

item.name: Repositorio Digital de Patrimonio Cultural de México (RDPCM)
MEXICANA
Maalr
item.note: Maalr: A Modern Approach to Aggregate Lexical Resources.

item.name: devochdelia
item.note: versión digital y en línea del Diccionario Etimolójico de las Voces Chilenas Derivadas de Lenguas Indíjenas Americanas

item.name: WebGL
item.note: WebGL™ is a cross-platform, royalty-free open web standard for a low-level 3D graphics API based on OpenGL ES, exposed to ECMAScript via the HTML5 Canvas element.

item.name: Palimpsest
item.note: 'Palimpsest: Literary Edinburgh' originally arose out of the idea of creating an innovative new way of engaging people with literature to celebrate the 250th anniversary of the University of Edinburgh's English Literature department, the oldest in the world.

item.name: Cytoscape’s tools for network visualization and statistical analysis
Juxta
item.note: Juxta is an open-source tool for comparing and collating multiple witnesses to a single textual work. Originally designed to aid scholars and editors examine the history of a text from manuscript to print versions, Juxta offers a number of possibilities for humanities computing and textual scholarship.

item.name: FromThePage
item.note: FromThePage is a crowdsourcing platform for archives and libraries where volunteers transcribe, index, and describe historic documents

item.name: RubyOnRails
item.note: A web-app framework that includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications according to the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern.

item.name: 3ds Max
item.note: Autodesk 3ds Max, formerly 3D Studio and 3D Studio Max, is a professional 3D computer graphics program for making 3D animations, models, games and images.

item.name: R
item.note: R is a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

item.name: TIS API
item.note: REST-based web service that allows partner collections to integrate Tesserae intertext search directly into their web applications.

item.name: Tesserae Intertext Search
item.note: Tesserae is a freely available tool for detecting allusions in Latin poetry. It was created by the Textual Analysis Working Group, a collaborative, interdisciplinary research team based at the University at Buffalo.

item.name: Language Archive Cologne
item.note: The Language Archive Cologne (LAC) supports research, learning and teaching with high quality and dependable digital language resources.

item.name: DUCAT
item.note: A tool that uses the CITE Architecture, allowing alignments among texts. It is a zero-infrastructure HTML app that exports data in a plain-text CEX format.

item.name: ApacheSpark
item.note: Apache Spark™ is a multi-language engine for executing data engineering, data science, and machine learning on single-node machines or clusters.

Apache Spark started as a research project at the UC Berkeley AMPLab in 2009, and was open sourced in early 2010. Many of the ideas behind the system were presented in various research papers over the years.

item.name: Unreal Engine
item.ref: Unreal Engine is the world's most open and advanced real-time 3D creation tool for photoreal visuals and immersive experiences.
item.note: Unreal Engine is the world's most open and advanced real-time 3D creation tool for photoreal visuals and immersive experiences.

item.name: TEI XSL Stylesheets
item.ref: This is a family of XSLT 2.0 stylesheets to transform TEI XML documents to various formats, including XHTML, LaTeX, XSL Formatting Objects, ePub, plain text, RDF, JSON; and to/from Word OOXML (docx) and OpenOffice (odt). They concentrate on the core TEI modules which are used for simple transcription and "born digital" writing.

item.name: TEI Boilerplate
item.ref: TEI Boilerplate (http://teiboilerplate.org/) is a lightweight solution for publishing styled TEI (Text Encoding Initiative) P5 content directly in modern browsers. With TEI Boilerplate, TEI XML files can be served directly to the web without server-side processing or translation to HTML.
